thread.title: Bollywood Duos Who Posed Together On Magazine Covers But Are Yet To Work Together In Movies
thread.title_full: Bollywood Duos Who Posed Together On Magazine Covers But Are Yet To Work Together In Movies

title: Bollywood Duos Who Posed Together On Magazine Covers But Are Yet To Work Together In Movies
text:
facebook 149 SHARES 
Every month we see our favourite stars shining on the covers of various magazines. From stunning photo shoots to juicy gossip, these mags provide that monthly dose of entertainment. But as we were rifling through some glossies, we realised that many celebrity duos that featured together on covers, have not worked together in movies. Curious? 
Jacqueline Fernandez and Harshvardhan Kapoor 
This newbie hottie was seen posing with the gorgeous Jacqueline on the cover of Harper's Bazaar Bride. Wearing a Ralph and Russo couture gown, Jacqueline looked no less than a dream. Accompanying her was Harshvardhn, looking fetch in an Ermenegildo Zegna suit. We think this couple should soon star together on the silver screen. 
Salman Khan and Aathiya Shetty 
They both posed for Hello magazine. This goes back to the time when Aathiya was all set to make her big Bollywood debut. Salman Khan looks super dapper as Athiya poses next to the superstar godfather. 
Hrithik Roshan and Lisa Haydon 
They created a stir appearing together on the cover of Vogue. We are wondering, why no director thought of signing these two good-looking people together? Casting directors, are you listening? 
Sonakshi Sinha and Aditya Roy Kapoor 
Sona and Adi were supposed to star in the Hindi remake of the film O Kadhal Kanmani . However, later Shraddha Kapoor stepped into Sonakshi's shoes. The movie titled Ok Jaanu , released early this year and didn't do really well at the box-office. 
Anushka Sharma and Abhay Deol 
We think the two complement each other really well. Now that both of them are seen doing quality films, and are super talented (do we even need to say that?), we think they should definitely sign a movie together. What say? Photo Credit: BCCL/Twitter
